episodes.title: Is Transcendental Meditation A Cult? Part 02
episodes.description:
SIDE B: WHY IS TRANSCENDENTAL MEDITATION? 

Early 20th Century: Where the Machiavellian Monk fakes his master’s will 

Chronicles the early years the Brahamachari Mahesh, soon to be “The Maharishi Mahesh Yogi.” His time at university learning physics, alleged forging of the will of his master: Guru Dev, and Maharishi fleeing Jyotir Monastery. 

60’s: Christ figure on the lamb becomes Sexy Sadie 

Here we set the stage capturing the zeitgeist of the era. Where Maharishi Mahesh Yogi cultivates followers. We discuss his allure, and The Beatles' interest in Hinduism. After Beatles father figure Brian Epstein dies, Maharishi meets the Beatles. We discuss the far-out con-man Magic Alex. Which lead us into The Beatles infamous Rishikesh India trip.  

We break for more systems of purported ‘thought control’. This time confession.  
Then we switch gears to ‘Forest Retreats’ at MIU; and explain what TM calls ‘rounding.’  
Then we discuss long-term meditation and its adverse side effects. First from a historic perspective in the writing of songs such as Yer Blues, Dear Prudence, and Mother Nature’s Son. Then with academic Perspectives from: Michael Persinger Arnold Lazarus, a Stanford Study, then a German government study on the systemic extraction of wealth from individuals in the TM organization. 
We return to Rishikesh where we chronicle the writing of the White Album. Bad business deals with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi and the leaving of Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr.  
Then, there is testimony of Maharishi grooming 19 year old Theresa Olson since she was 10. As well as testamony by Judith Baroque and Prof. Robert Gordon McCutchen. We talk about the origins of the song "Sexy Sadie" The hearsay and history of what happened between Maharishi and Mia Farrow, and Rosalyn Bonas which led to The Beatles' fallout. The 70’s ends with The Beach Boys' connections to Maharishi, their abusive father, and Dennis Wilson picking up another guru by the name of Charles Manson.
